page.title: 10LEOMINSTER CATTLE MARKET
page.content: The market is owned by auctioneers Russell Baldwin and Bright. The market was originally where the International store is now, but it was moved to Easters meadows on the A.49, where { {Leominster}by-pass will be constructed in July 1986. The market was re-sited because there is more room for large lorries to park, more space to extend the market and easy access for farmers. Calves and weanlings are sold on Fridays, beef cattle monthly and sheep sales are held in August. Of the total cattle sold on Saturday 15th June 1985, 76.5% were Hereford cross Friesian, 3.25% were pure Herefords, 9.75% were French Charollais cross and 10.5% were French Limousin cattle.
